DataElement.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Therapeutic Procedure Immunosuppressive Therapy Occurrence Final Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date of the final administration of immunotherapy, suppression of the body's immune system and its ability to fight infections or disease induced with drugs, to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of acute graft versus host disease, a syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract with an onset usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Therapeutic Procedure Immunosuppressive Therapy Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the administration of immunotherapy, suppression of the body's immune system and its ability to fight infections or disease induced with drugs, to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of acute graft versus host disease, a syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract with an onset usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Therapeutic Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: deliberate suppression of immune system function for experimental or therapeutic purposes.:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: deliberate suppression of immune system function for experimental or therapeutic purposes.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Conclusive or final particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Conclusive in a process or progression.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: Conclusive in a process or progression.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
